steps.instruction: In a large bowl, sift together the flour, baking powder, salt and sugar.
steps.tip: Sifting helps create lighter, fluffier pancakes by aerating the flour.

steps.instruction: Make a well in the center and pour in the milk, egg and melted butter. Mix until smooth.
steps.tip: Don't overmix! A few lumps are okay and will result in tender pancakes.

steps.instruction: Heat a lightly oiled griddle or frying pan over medium-high heat.
steps.tip: Test if the pan is ready by sprinkling a few drops of water - they should sizzle.

steps.instruction: Pour or scoop the batter onto the griddle, using approximately Â¼ cup for each pancake.
steps.tip: Wait for bubbles to form on the surface before flipping - this ensures even cooking.

steps.instruction: Brown on both sides and serve hot with your favorite toppings.
steps.tip: Stack pancakes on a warm plate and cover with foil to keep them hot while cooking the rest.

steps.instruction: Bring a large pot of salted water to boil and cook spaghetti according to package directions.
steps.tip: Save 1 cup of pasta water before draining - you'll need it for the sauce.

steps.instruction: While pasta cooks, dice the pancetta and cook in a large pan until crispy.
steps.tip: No oil needed! The pancetta will release its own fat for cooking.

steps.instruction: In a bowl, whisk together eggs, grated cheese, and plenty of black pepper.
steps.tip: Use room temperature eggs to prevent them from scrambling when mixed with hot pasta.

steps.instruction: Drain pasta and add to the pan with pancetta. Remove from heat.
steps.tip: Removing from heat is crucial - this prevents the eggs from scrambling.

steps.instruction: Quickly add the egg mixture and toss vigorously, adding pasta water to create a creamy sauce.
steps.tip: The residual heat will cook the eggs gently. Keep tossing for a silky, glossy finish.

steps.instruction: Preheat oven to 375Â°F. In a small bowl, combine flour, baking soda, and salt.
steps.tip: Make sure your oven is fully preheated for even baking.

steps.instruction: In a large bowl, beat softened butter with both sugars until creamy.
steps.tip: The butter should be soft but not melted - leave it at room temperature for 30 minutes.

steps.instruction: Add eggs and vanilla extract to butter mixture and beat well.
steps.tip: Scrape down the sides of the bowl to ensure everything is well incorporated.

steps.instruction: Gradually blend in the flour mixture, then stir in chocolate chips.
steps.tip: Don't overmix after adding flour - this can make cookies tough.

steps.instruction: Drop rounded tablespoons of dough onto ungreased baking sheets. Bake for 9-11 minutes.
steps.tip: Cookies will look slightly underdone when you remove them - they'll firm up as they cool.

steps.instruction: Heat a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add ground beef and cook until browned, breaking it up with a spoon.
steps.tip: Drain excess fat after browning for healthier tacos.

steps.instruction: Add taco seasoning and water according to packet directions. Simmer for 5 minutes.
steps.tip: Let the sauce thicken completely for maximum flavor.

steps.instruction: While meat simmers, prepare your toppings: shred lettuce, dice tomatoes, and grate cheese.
steps.tip: Cold, crisp vegetables provide a nice contrast to the warm meat.

steps.instruction: Warm taco shells according to package directions, either in the oven or microwave.
steps.tip: Warming shells makes them more pliable and less likely to crack.

steps.instruction: Fill each shell with seasoned beef, then top with lettuce, tomatoes, cheese, sour cream, and salsa.
steps.tip: Layer ingredients strategically: meat first, then cheese to melt, then cold toppings on top.

stirfry.title: Vegetable Stir Fry
ingredients: 2 cups mixed vegetables (broccoli, bell peppers, carrots)

steps.instruction: Prepare all vegetables by washing and cutting into bite-sized pieces. Have everything ready before you start cooking.
steps.tip: Mise en place is crucial for stir fry - everything cooks fast once you start!

steps.instruction: Heat a wok or large pan over high heat until very hot. Add vegetable oil and swirl to coat.
steps.tip: A hot wok is the secret to that restaurant-quality sear and texture.

steps.instruction: Add garlic and ginger, stir fry for 30 seconds until fragrant.
steps.tip: Keep stirring constantly to prevent burning - aromatics cook very quickly.

steps.instruction: Add vegetables starting with the hardest ones first (carrots, broccoli). Stir fry for 3-4 minutes.
steps.tip: Add softer vegetables like bell peppers in the last minute for best texture.

steps.instruction: Add soy sauce and sesame oil, toss well. Serve over rice and garnish with sesame seeds.
steps.tip: The sauce will steam and create a delicious glaze - don't add too much liquid.

steps.instruction: Add frozen berries, banana, yogurt, milk, and honey to a high-powered blender.
steps.tip: Use frozen fruit for a thick, ice-cream like consistency without ice.

steps.instruction: Blend on high speed until smooth and thick, stopping to scrape down sides as needed.
steps.tip: Add liquid gradually - you want it thick enough to eat with a spoon!

steps.instruction: Pour the smoothie into a bowl - it should be thick enough to support toppings.
steps.tip: If too thin, add more frozen fruit and blend again.

steps.instruction: Arrange toppings in sections: granola on one side, fresh fruit, and chia seeds.
steps.tip: Get creative with your toppings - nuts, coconut flakes, and cocoa nibs work great!

steps.instruction: Serve immediately while cold and enjoy with a spoon.
steps.tip: Smoothie bowls are best eaten right away before they melt and lose their thick texture.

steps.instruction: Crack eggs into a bowl and add milk. Whisk vigorously until well combined and slightly frothy.
steps.tip: Whisking incorporates air for fluffier eggs. Don't skip this step!

steps.instruction: Heat a non-stick pan over medium-low heat and add butter. Let it melt and coat the pan.
steps.tip: Low heat is key! High heat makes eggs rubbery. Patience pays off here.

steps.instruction: Pour in the egg mixture. Wait 20 seconds, then gently push eggs from edges to center with a spatula.
steps.tip: Use a silicone spatula and make slow, gentle movements. Don't constantly stir.

steps.instruction: Continue gently folding eggs every 10-15 seconds. Remove from heat when still slightly wet.
steps.tip: Eggs continue cooking off heat. Remove them when they're 80% done for perfect creaminess.

steps.instruction: Season with salt and pepper. Garnish with fresh herbs if desired. Serve immediately.
steps.tip: Salt at the end to prevent eggs from getting watery. Enjoy while hot and creamy!
